data.title: Thaksin 'targets 3 PAO election races'
data.description: Former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra will assist Pheu Thai candidates contesting provincial administrative organisation (PAO) chairman elections in Ubon Ratchathani, Chiang Mai, and Si Sa Ket after the party

data.title: Wong visit bodes well for future
data.description: Food security, energy security, the green economy, and digital connectivity were among the topics discussed on Thursday by Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra and her Singapore counterpart Lawrence Wong.

data.title: King to open Rama X Bridge next month
data.description: The construction of the Rama X Bridge across the Chao Phraya River is complete, with Exat Governor Surachet Laophulsuk announcing that His Majesty the King will preside over the opening ceremony on Dec 14.

data.title: Severe flooding continues in South, trains disrupted
data.description: More than 130,000 households in seven southern provinces have been hit by  floods  following downpours that are forecast to continue in many areas until Dec 3.

data.title: Hunger-striking fraud suspect Samart falls ill
data.description: Politician  Samart Janechaijittawanich , a suspect in a money laundering case linked to The  iCon Group  fraud and money-laundering scandal, has been rushed to the Department of Corrections Hospital after almost four days on  hunger strike  in prison.

data.title: Shade finally returns to main Samui ferry pier
data.description: SURAT THANI - The main  ferry  pier on  Koh Samui  is finally getting its roofs back, after a full year in which passengers have had to endure rain and sometimes scorching sun on their way to and from the boats.

data.title: Gunman surrenders a day after Isan triple killing
data.description: NONG BUA LAM PHU - The 58-year-old  gunman  who shot three people to death in this northeastern province surrendered to police on Thursday, a day after the killings.

data.title: Facial recognition for international flight passengers starts Dec 1
data.description: Facial recognition services at six major airports will be expanded to include passengers on international flights starting Dec 1, according to Airports of Thailand Plc (AOT).

data.title: Cyber police target avatar accounts for spreading false allegations against PTT executives
data.description: The Cyber Crime Investigation Bureau (CCIB) is focusing on three "avatar accounts" accused of disseminating false information aimed at tarnishing the reputations of PTT executives. Authorities are preparing to press serious charges against those responsible.

data.title: Illegal Chinese-owned salon in Bangkok shut down
data.description: Police raided an illegal full-service beauty salon owned by a Chinese woman in central Bangkok on Thursday and arrested seven female suspects for working without permits.

data.title: Facial recognition for international flight passengers
data.description: Facial recognition services at six major airports will be expanded to include passengers on international flights starting Dec 1, according to Airports of Thailand Plc (AOT).

data.title: Checkpoint set up to prevent foreigners from illegal work in Myanmar
data.description: TAK — Police have set up a highway checkpoint aimed at preventing foreigners from being enticed into illicit work in Myanmar near the border.

data.title: Severe flooding continues in South, train services disrupted
data.description: Heavy rain continues to pound all southern provinces along the Gulf of Thailand until Saturday, as many train services have been suspended due to flooded tracks between Pattani and Yala.

data.title: Social Security Fund boosts pension, severance
data.description: Social security  subscribers will receive more  pension  and severance pay once the way this is calculated has been revised as planned, according to the Social Security Board.

data.title: People's Party won't join Sondhi rally
data.description: The main opposition  People

data.title: Thailand’s biggest seizure of call scam equipment
data.description: Police conducted multiple raids in the northern province of Chiang Mai and made the country’s biggest seizure of call scam equipment installed by a Thai-Chinese gang.

data.title: 50,000 tickets with 30% discount for New Year’s domestic flights
data.description: Six airlines offer 50,000 domestic flight tickets with a 30% discount to New Year travelers, according to the transport minister

data.title: Rama 2 roadworks delayed 5 months
data.description: The deadline for the Rama II elevated road construction work in Samut Sakhon has been postponed from June to November of next year, according to the Expressway Authority of Thailand (Exat).

data.title: Call to register trucks before ban
data.description: The Department of Land Transport (DLT) is calling on operators of six-wheeled trucks and over to register their vehicles before City Hall implements its Low Emission Zone air pollution control programme next year.

data.title: 3 rounds of referendum 'essential'
data.description: Three rounds of referendum are a must for a proposed rewrite of the 2017 constitution, Nikorn Chamnong, secretary to the joint House-Senate House panel on the referendum bill, said.

data.title: SSF boosts pension, severance
data.description: Social security subscribers will receive more pension and severance pay once the way this is calculated has been revised as planned, according to the Social Security Board.

data.title: Army says no tensions with UWSA on border
data.description: The army has dismissed media reports about tensions over a standoff between Thai military forces and United Wa State Army (UWSA) fighters in Mae Hong Son

data.title: Floods ravage four southern provinces
data.description: The four southern provinces of Songkhla, Pattani, Yala and Narathiwat are being hit by heavy rain and severe floods that have ravaged houses and forced schools and roads to close.

data.title: PP won't join Sondhi rally
data.description: The main opposition People
